title: "broken pipe" exception in xa tests
description:
The regression started to fail on Nov 4th, here's the output 
https://regression-status.marklogic.com/new-app/space/diff-archive/b6_0/2012-11-14/linux-64-rh6/qa-stdout.txt.Split2.txt
You could go search TestXA to fine the XA tests. 

TestXABug13746 and TestXARestart throw "Broken pipe" exception, and the test TestXASessionCommit which fails right after TestXARestart throwing SVC-EXTIME exception caused the regression to fail. 

After I set the server "keep alive timeout" to 0, then all tests above passed. 

These tests passed on Solaris system all the time.

Ling, is what Aries is reporting consistent with you are seeing?  Is this bug an intermittent issue?
Aries and Jane, I made some changes to set keep alive timeout to 0 yesterday so this is why it passed.I'll email you guys about the changes.
Please provide a test case where this is reproducible, so as to avoid further back and forth on this.

set keep-alive-timeout in app servers TestXATrMgrSer1 and TestXATrMgrSer2 to 5
only include TestXABug13746* in xa tests in build.xml
make cleanest
make xa

the bug reproduced:

Testsuite: com.marklogic.xa.TestXABug13746
Tests run: 3, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Time elapsed: 11.64 sec

question: should we use XCC/6.0-1 to reproduce the bug? or use the latest nightly?
the unit test report shows the test uses 6.0-1.

No, I am using the xcc I built on b6_0, whose version is still marked as 6.0-1.

Test failed at testSetJournalSizeBack() in TestXABug13746.

I worked with Ling on this.  I am never able to reproduce this problem in my dev environment.  But based on the tests, here's what I believe that happened:

There's a connection that is created and cached.  The server gets restarted.  The connection is reused to submit a query after the restart, which gets the broken pipe.  Prior to the change on 11/3, the connection will only be cached for up to 1 second, so it's not reused.  After the change on 11/3, the connection is cached to 5 seconds.  So the connection is reused while the server has already been restarted.

Since the behavior of the test is time sensitive, I have suggested to Ling to either change the keep alive to 0 or to change the server restart to a forest restart.  She tried both, and both worked fine.  So I'm closing this bug.
No code bug found.  Test has been updated.
